title: Carroll Baker
summary: Carroll Baker (born May 28, 1931) is an American actress. After studying under Lee Strasberg at the Actors Studio, Baker began performing on Broadway in 1954. From there, she was recruited by director Elia Kazan to play the lead in the adaptation of two Tennessee Williams plays into the film Baby Doll in 1956. Her role in the film as a coquettish but sexually na√Øve Southern bride earned her a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress.
